item.title: 草药股暴涨铸就 260 亿美元财富
item.description: 一家亏损的小中药公司股票大涨，使其创始人的净资产跻身全球百大富豪之列。【原文：A blistering rally in a tiny, money-losing traditional Chinese medicine company’s stock has vaulted its founder’s net worth to among the world’s 100 largest fortunes.】

item.title: 雪佛龙首次涉足锂业，与斯马科弗公司达成交易
item.description: 雪佛龙公司（Chevron Corp. ）首次涉足锂业，在得克萨斯州东北部和阿肯色州西南部进行了两块耕地交易，旨在建立国内 "商业规模 "业务。【原文：Chevron Corp. made its first foray into lithium with two acreage deals in northeast Texas and southwest Arkansas aimed at building a domestic “commercial scale” business.】

item.title: 参议院希望就盐税和医疗补助达成协议，但税收法案仍无投票权
item.description: 共和党领导人的目标是就新公布的参议院税收法案所需的修改进行快速谈判，因为该法案缺乏在参众两院获得多数票的票数。【原文：Republican leaders are aiming for quick negotiations over needed changes to the newly unveiled Senate tax bill which lacks the votes to secure majorities in both chambers as written.】

item.title: Salesforce 提高价格，推广新的人工智能功能
item.description: Salesforce 公司正在提高许多产品的价格，成为在整合人工智能的过程中调整成本结构的最新一家软件制造商。【原文：Salesforce Inc. is increasing the price for many products, becoming the latest software maker to adjust its cost structure as it integrates artificial intelligence.】

item.title: Teamworks 完成 F 轮融资，估值达到 10 亿美元
item.description: Teamworks 在新一轮融资中筹集了 2.35 亿美元，使这家体育数据公司的市值超过 10 亿美元。【原文：Teamworks has raised $235 million in a new funding round that pushes the value of the sports data company to more than $1 billion.】

item.title: 美国住宅建筑商信心降至 2022 年底以来最低水平
item.description: 6 月份，美国住宅建筑商的信心降至 2022 年 12 月以来的最低水平，高抵押贷款利率以及对关税和经济的担忧令潜在买家望而却步。【原文：Confidence among US homebuilders fell to the lowest level since December 2022 in June, with potential buyers deterred by high mortgage rates and anxiety about tariffs and the economy.】

item.title: 摩根大通分析师称英国银行将进行更多整合
item.description: 摩根大通银行（JPMorgan Chase & Co.【原文：Larger UK banks are likely to go into acquisition mode as they benefit from expanding deposit margins, with smaller rivals looking like attractive targets, according to analysts at JPMorgan Chase & Co.】

item.title: 特朗普淡化以色列与伊朗停战前景，美国股市下跌
item.description: 由于美国总统唐纳德-特朗普淡化了以色列和伊朗之间可能达成的停战协议，且零售销售数据不及预期，周二美国股市下跌。【原文：US stocks declined on Tuesday as President Donald Trump played down a potential truce between Israel and Iran, and retail sales data came in softer than expected.】

item.title: 23andMe 因基因数据泄露被英国罚款 231 万英镑
item.description: 在 2023 年的一次网络攻击暴露了用户的基因数据后，23andMe 被英国监管机构罚款 231 万英镑（310 万美元），这是这家陷入困境的 DNA 数据库遭遇的又一次隐私危机。【原文：23andMe was fined £2.31 million ($3.1 million) by UK regulators after a 2023 cyber attack exposed users’ genetic data in yet another privacy crisis surrounding the troubled DNA data bank.】

item.title: 七国集团领导人峰会最新情况
item.description: 6 月 15 日，在加拿大艾伯塔省班夫举行的七国集团（G-7）领导人峰会期间，七国集团媒体中心的指示牌。摄影师：加文-约翰/布鲁姆伯格【原文：Signage at the G7 Media Centre during the Group of Seven (G-7) Leaders' Summit in Banff, Alberta, Canada, on June 15. Photographer: Gavin John/Bloomberg】

item.title: 美联储降息预期不变，国债保持涨势
item.description: 由于美国经济数据维持了美联储将在 2025 年至少再降息一次的预期不变，国债收益率周二有所下降。【原文：Treasury yields declined Tuesday as US economic data left intact expectations that the Federal Reserve will cut interest rates at least once more in 2025.】

item.title: 马斯克的 xAI 正在洽谈 43 亿美元的股权融资
item.description: 根据埃隆-马斯克（Elon Musk）的人工智能初创公司 xAI 与投资者分享的信息，该公司正在商谈通过股权投资筹集 43 亿美元的资金，这是该公司最近试图向债务投资者借款 50 亿美元的基础。【原文：Elon Musk’s artificial intelligence startup xAI is in talks to raise $4.3 billion through an equity investment on top of the $5 billion it has recently been trying to borrow from debt investors, according to information the company shared with investors who asked not to be identified because it is private.】

item.title: 英国央行决议前嘈杂数据令通胀形势扑朔迷离
item.description: 预计周三公布的英国通胀数据将有所降温，但在对官方数据的新质疑声中，较低的数字可能不会缓解英国经济价格压力的不确定性。【原文：UK inflation is expected to cool in figures due to be released Wednesday, but a lower number may to do little to ease uncertainty about price pressures in the British economy amid fresh questions about the official data.】

item.title: 可可从一周高位回落，降雨对作物有利
item.description: 可可期货从一周高点回落，原因是人们预期世界最大产区最近的降雨有望改善土壤湿度，促进作物生长。【原文：Cocoa futures fell from a one-week high amid expectations that recent rains in the world’s biggest producing region are expected to improve soil moisture and boost crops.】

item.title: 美国工业产出三个月来第二次下降
item.description: 美国 5 月份工业生产在三个月内第二次出现下降，反映出公用事业产出疲软和制造业疲软。【原文：US industrial production declined in May for the second time in three months, reflecting weaker utility output and soft manufacturing.】

item.title: 爱尔兰取消 AIB 和 PTSB 高管的薪酬上限
item.description: 爱尔兰财政部长帕夏尔-多诺霍（Paschal Donohoe）表示，将取消 AIB Group Plc 和 Permanent TSB Group Plc 高管的工资上限。【原文：Salary caps for executives at AIB Group Plc and Permanent TSB Group Plc will be removed, Ireland’s Minister for Finance Paschal Donohoe said.】

item.title: 欧盟禁用俄罗斯天然气的提议将引发激烈谈判
item.description: 欧盟提议在 2027 年底之前禁止使用所有俄罗斯天然气，这引发了激烈的争论，一些成员国紧张地表示，这将提高能源价格，并使公司支付数百万欧元的法律费用。【原文：The European Union’s proposed ban on all Russian gas by the end of 2027 sets the stage for heated debate, with some member states nervous it will boost energy prices and cost companies millions of euros in legal fees.】

item.title: 里夫斯称英国不会在本届议会再次提高国防预算
item.description: 英国财政大臣雷切尔-里夫斯（Rachel Reeves）表示，英国国防预算的任何进一步增加都要等到下一届议会，这引发了人们对政府如何履行北约开支承诺的疑问。【原文：Chancellor of the Exchequer Rachel Reeves has said any further rise to the UK’s budget for defense won’t come until the next parliament, raising questions about how the government will meet NATO spending commitments.】

item.title: 巴克莱称收盘时出现的信贷交易是赝品
item.description: 巴克莱银行（Barclays Plc）对被动投资的兴起正在扭曲债券市场的说法提出质疑，认为信贷交易集中在一天的末尾有另一种解释。【原文：Barclays Plc is challenging claims that the rise of passive investing is distorting the bond market, arguing there’s an alternative explanation for why credit trades are clustering around the end of the day.】

item.title: Adobe 推出用于生成人工智能视频和图像的独立应用程序
item.description: Adobe 公司周二发布了安卓和 iOS 版独立 Firefly 移动应用程序，试图让更多人关注其人工智能驱动的图像生成和编辑工具。【原文：Adobe Inc. on Tuesday released a standalone Firefly mobile application for Android and iOS in an attempt to put a larger spotlight on its artificial intelligence-powered image generation and editing tools.】

item.title: 阿森松医疗集团斥资 39 亿美元收购 Amsurg 公司，扩大业务范围
item.description: 据知情人士透露，Ascension Health 已同意以约 39 亿美元的价格收购曾隶属于 Envision Healthcare Corp. 的非住院手术公司 AmSurg。【原文：Ascension Health has agreed to buy AmSurg, an ambulatory surgery company once part of Envision Healthcare Corp., for about $3.9 billion, according to people with knowledge of the matter.】

item.title: 中东战争升级，新兴市场仍保持平静
item.description: 以色列与伊朗冲突的恶化对新兴市场的地缘政治风险溢价影响不大，投资者押注德黑兰过于软弱，不会引发全球市场危机。【原文：The worsening Israel-Iran conflict is having little impact on the geopolitical risk premium for emerging markets, with investors betting that Tehran is too weak to spark a global market crisis.】

item.title: 受汽车拖累，美国零售销售额连续第二个月下滑
item.description: 美国 5 月份零售销售额连续第二个月下降，表明对关税及其财务状况的焦虑促使消费者在年初的消费热潮之后有所收敛。【原文：US retail sales fell for a second month in May, suggesting anxiety over tariffs and their finances prompted consumers to pull back after an early-year spending rush.】

item.title: 查默斯称澳大利亚对世界动荡 "应变能力不足
item.description: 澳大利亚财政部长吉姆-查莫斯（Jim Chalmers）表示，澳大利亚的经济和预算需要更多的压舱石来抵御最新一轮的全球波动，尽管他强调澳大利亚的经济状况好于许多发达国家。【原文：Australia’s economy and budget need further ballast to withstand the latest rounds of global volatility, Treasurer Jim Chalmers said, even as he highlighted that the nation is better positioned than many developed-world counterparts.】

item.title: 新期货合约旨在将信用套期保值返还加拿大
item.description: 蒙特利尔交易所（Montreal Exchange Inc.【原文：Montreal Exchange Inc. plans to launch a Canadian bank credit futures contract next year, at a time when heightened macro volatility is boosting global demand for access to the market.】

item.title: 加密货币正在投资民主党人，以推进国会议程
item.description: 加密货币公司正在向民主党人投资，因为他们正试图在国会强行通过对行业有利的监管制度，并确保新法律在唐纳德-特朗普总统卸任后继续有效。【原文：Crypto companies are investing in Democrats as they seek to muscle an industry-friendly regulatory regime through Congress and ensure new laws persist after President Donald Trump leaves office.】

item.title: 甲骨文斥资 1160 亿美元在人工智能领域大展拳脚
item.description: 甲骨文公司（Oracle Corp. ）的投资者正处于一个关键的十字路口。越来越多的指标表明，甲骨文的股价已经涨得太快太猛了；要么听从这些指标的警告，要么继续追逐人工智能高预期带来的另一波涨势。【原文：Oracle Corp. investors find themselves at a pivotal crossroads. Either heed the warning from a growing list of indicators that suggest the stock has run up too far, too fast — or continue to chase another rally that’s been supercharged by lofty artificial intelligence expectations.】

item.title: 西班牙称电压控制失误导致四月大停电
item.description: 西班牙已查明 4 月 28 日历史性停电的原因，并表示这是由于缺乏控制电压变化的能力。【原文：Spain has identified the causes of the historic April 28 electricity outage and signaled that it was due to a lack of capacity to control voltage changes.】

item.title: 应用直觉公司的人工智能汽车技术估值达 150 亿美元
item.description:
该公司向投资者募集了 6 亿美元，为最终上市做准备。【原文：

The company raised $600 million from investors as it prepares for an eventual IPO.

】

item.title: 全球首款大众市场电动汽车焕然一新
item.description: 日产汽车公司（Nissan Motor Co., Ltd.）将推出聆风（Leaf）的升级版，为其产品线注入新的活力。聆风是日产旗下的一款紧凑型家用车，也是世界上第一款面向大众市场的电动汽车。【原文：Nissan Motor Co.’s push to breathe new life into its lineup will see the debut of an updated version of the Leaf, the struggling brand’s compact family car that was the world’s first mass-market electric vehicle.】
